snippet: Consumer spending dropped 0.2 percent in October, the government said, down from an increase of 0.8 percent in September and the weakest showing since May.
abstract: Commerce Department says that consumer spending dropped 0.2 percent in October, down from an increase of 0.8 percent in September and the weakest showing since May.
lead_paragraph: Consumer spending dropped 0.2 percent in October, the government said, down from an increase of 0.8 percent in September and the weakest showing since May.

headline.seo: Consumer Spending Reported Down 0.2% in October
headline.main: Drop in Consumer Spending May Signal Weaker Growth
headline.print_headline: Drop in Consumer Spending May Signal Weaker Growth
